questions.question: Which sentence uses the first conditional correctly?
options: If you had called me, I would have answered.
If you call me, I will answer.
If you called me, I would answer.
If you will call me, I will answer.
questions.answer: If you call me, I will answer.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'If they _____ now, they will arrive on time.'
options: left
leave
leaves
will leave

questions.question: What is the correct first conditional sentence?
options: If he studied, he will pass the test.
If he study, he will pass the test.
If he studies, he will pass the test.
If he studies, he passes the test.
questions.answer: If he studies, he will pass the test.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'If I don't eat breakfast, I _____ hungry later.'
options: would be
will be
was
am

questions.question: Which sentence is an example of the first conditional?
options: If I see her, I told her the news.
If I saw her, I would tell her the news.
If I had seen her, I would have told her.
If I see her, I will tell her the news.
questions.answer: If I see her, I will tell her the news.
